byline.contributor: Jeffrey Gettleman reported from Nairobi, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong. Dennis Okeyo contributed reporting from Nairobi, Chris Buckley from Beijing, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and AUSTIN RAMZY

abstract: Taiwan accuses Kenya of violating international law and trying to curry favor after it deports group of Taiwanese prisoners to China; China's growing financial clout in Africa has given it increased influence, particularly over authoritarian governments.
lead_paragraph: Taiwanese officials accused Kenya of violating international law, using tear gas on their citizens, and trying to curry favor with China, a heavyweight in Africa.

headline.main: Taiwan Accuses Kenya of Illegal Deportations as More Are Sent to China
headline.print_headline: Taiwan Accuses Kenya of Illegal Deportations as More Are Sent to China

snippet: Taiwanese officials accused Kenya of violating international law, using tear gas on their citizens, and trying to curry favor with China, a heavyweight in Africa.
